text: have any of you cool cats played around with proxies?

We're seeing a sudden spike in 500 errors from `<https://js.hsleadflows.net/leadflows.js>`. Has anyone else noticed this today?
It is happening on multiple pages on our site. It does not occur every time, but our BugSnag logs show the error occurred for our website users 43 times today (and 32 times total in the past 30 days otherwise). The specific error is at: `<https://js.hsleadflows.net/leadflows.js:3:24379> TypeError · Cannot read property 'length' of undefined`
Looking at the breadcrumbs it seems related to an API request a HubSpot file must be making for `GET <https://forms.HubSpot.com/lead-flows-config/v1/config/json>` 

Anyone have any idea what's going on or why our users are suddenly seeing a large number of these 500 errors from leadflows? This has me pretty concerned.
